# Installation

`npm install --save-dev hardhat-ens-mock`

`yarn add -D hardhat-ens-mock`

# Use case / Motivation

As an EVM dev that likes to test his code, I often find myself working with hardhat forks from other chains, and then linking all sorts of applications that need orchestration, for example through docker. I 've always found it hard to make simple orchestrations work, mainly due to the ever changing nature of the blockchain state, I would always need to deploy some contracts, addresses may or may have not changed since the last run, I must copy them over in the form of environment variables to the rest of the apps, etc.

With this plugin, I intend to build a tool for hardhat that allows to bootstrap and manipulate a predictable ENS deployment that helps me in orchestrating this stuff. By providing a static, predictable layer, I can deploy a contract, ABI or any arbitrary data to an ENS name that is always live in the ENS registry at `0x00000000000C2E074eC69A0dFb2997BA6C7d2e1e`, without worrying of which address the contract had, or which tokenID, or if the ABI has changed, etc.

# In construction

Some resources:
https://programtheblockchain.com/posts/2018/03/09/understanding-ethereum-smart-contract-storage/
http://man.hubwiz.com/docset/Ethereum.docset/Contents/Resources/Documents/eth_getStorageAt.html
https://www.npmjs.com/package/@ensdomains/ens-contracts
https://docs.ens.domains/contract-api-reference/name-processing

Sample code:

```ts
import { hexZeroPad } from "@ethersproject/bytes";
import { HashZero } from "@ethersproject/constants";
import { keccak256 } from "@ethersproject/solidity";
import { BigNumber } from "ethers";
import { namehash } from "ethers/lib/utils";
import { DeployFunction } from "hardhat-deploy/types";
import { HardhatRuntimeEnvironment } from "hardhat/types";
import { ENS, ENS__factory } from "../../src/typechain";

const ENS_REGISTRY_BYTECODE =
  "";
const ENS_REGISTRY_ADDRESS = "0x00000000000C2E074eC69A0dFb2997BA6C7d2e1e";

async function queryShit(key: string, ens: ENS, hre: HardhatRuntimeEnvironment) {
  const ownerSlot = keccak256(["uint256", "uint256"], [BigNumber.from(key), "0"]);
  const resolverSlot = hexZeroPad(BigNumber.from(ownerSlot).add(1).toHexString(), 32);
  const ttlSlot = hexZeroPad(BigNumber.from(ownerSlot).add(2).toHexString(), 32);

  const owner = (await hre.network.provider.send("eth_getStorageAt", [
    ENS_REGISTRY_ADDRESS,
    ownerSlot,
    "latest",
  ])) as string;
  const resolver = (await hre.network.provider.send("eth_getStorageAt", [
    ENS_REGISTRY_ADDRESS,
    resolverSlot,
    "latest",
  ])) as string;
  const ttl = (await hre.network.provider.send("eth_getStorageAt", [
    ENS_REGISTRY_ADDRESS,
    ttlSlot,
    "latest",
  ])) as string;

  console.log(`\nNODE_HASH: ${key}`);
  console.log("=================================");
  const queryOwner = await ens.owner(key).then((result) => hexZeroPad(result.toLowerCase(), 32));
  console.log("Owners", queryOwner === owner, queryOwner, hexZeroPad(owner.toLowerCase(), 32));

  const queryResolver = await ens.resolver(key).then((result) => hexZeroPad(result.toLowerCase(), 32));
  console.log("Resolvers", queryResolver === resolver, queryResolver, hexZeroPad(resolver.toLowerCase(), 32));

  const queryTTL = await ens.ttl(key).then((result) => hexZeroPad(result.toHexString(), 32));
  console.log("TTL", queryTTL === ttl, queryTTL, hexZeroPad(ttl.toLowerCase(), 32));

  return { ownerSlot, resolverSlot, ttlSlot };
}

const func: DeployFunction = async function (hre: HardhatRuntimeEnvironment) {
  await hre.network.provider.send("hardhat_setCode", [ENS_REGISTRY_ADDRESS, ENS_REGISTRY_BYTECODE]);
  const ens = ENS__factory.connect(ENS_REGISTRY_ADDRESS, hre.ethers.provider);
  const rootNode = HashZero;
  const ensNode = HashZero;
  const randomNode = namehash("random.eth");

  const { ownerSlot } = await queryShit(rootNode, ens, hre);
  await queryShit(randomNode, ens, hre);

  const [newRootOwner, wtfOwner, randomOwner] = await hre.ethers.getSigners();
  await hre.network.provider.send("hardhat_setStorageAt", [
    ENS_REGISTRY_ADDRESS,
    ownerSlot,
    hexZeroPad(newRootOwner.address, 32),
  ]);

  const wtfLabel = "wtf";
  const wtfLabelHash = keccak256(["string"], [wtfLabel]);
  const wtfDomainHash = namehash(wtfLabel);

  await ens.connect(newRootOwner).setSubnodeOwner(rootNode, wtfLabelHash, wtfOwner.address);
  console.log("wtf owner", await ens.owner(namehash("wtf")));

  const domain = "random.wtf";
  const otherLabel = "random";
  const randomWtfLabelHash = keccak256(["string"], [otherLabel]);
  const randomNameHash = namehash(domain);

  await ens.connect(wtfOwner).setSubnodeOwner(wtfDomainHash, randomWtfLabelHash, randomOwner.address);

  console.log("random.wtf owner", await ens.owner(randomNameHash));
};

export default func;
```
